sources.title: The Lost Missile
sources.description: “A ‘lost’ sci-fi classic” “Underrated” “Not bad” “Fifties shock cinema” “Fine effort” “Atomic doom” (IMDB reviews quotes). Red scare sci-fi terror -- but without the Reds. Large, okay cast and good production values for a drive-in quickie. IMDB rating 5.2. Directed by William Berke. Released in 1958. Complete print.

sources.title: The Lost Missile
sources.description: Title: The Lost Missile Summary: A strange missile from outer space circles the Earth at low altitudes, destroying everything in its path. Directed by: William Berke Actors: Robert Loggia, Ellen Parker, Phillip Pine Production Company: William Berke Productions Inc. Release Date: December 1958 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 The appearance of an unknown "missile-like" object in nearby space leads a European nation to fire a rocket at it. Though the rocket intercepts the unidentified object, the explosion only diverts the missile into an orbit around the Earth. Racing five miles above the earth, its passage causes widespread devastation of the land below.

sources.title: The Lost Missile (1958)
sources.description: The Lost Missile is a 1958 science fiction film directed by Lester Wm. Berke . Originally intended to be directed by his father, William Berke , the film became his son’s project after William’s sudden passing. Starring Robert Loggia and Ellen Parker , the film runs for approximately 70 minutes and explores themes of impending disaster during the Cold War era.  The story unfolds as an unidentified, missile-like object emerges in space, prompting a military response from a European nation strongly implied to be behind the Iron Curtain. Their attempt to intercept the object with a missile results in failure; instead of destruction, the explosion merely redirects the missile into a perilous orbit around the Earth. As the missile passes close to the ground—blazing and incinerating everything in its path—a team at the Havenbrook Atomic Laboratory is preparing for a wedding. The urgency escalates when the military recognizes the threat the missile poses to cities like New York.

metadata.Plot: The appearance of an unknown "missile-like" object in nearby space leads a European nation to fire a rocket at it. Though the rocket intercepts the unidentified object, the explosion only diverts the missile into an orbit around the Earth. Racing five miles above the earth, its passage causes widespread devastation of the land below.
metadata.Writer: John McPartland, Jerome Bixby, Lester Wm. Berke
metadata.Actors: Robert Loggia, Ellen Parker, Phillip Pine
